cscd210Classes

Class Rational

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd210Classes.Rational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Rational>

    public final class Rational
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Rational>
    A Rational class that will be used for this lab.
    NOTE:
    All parameters will be passed as final, all preconditions will be checked, this. must be used throughout, and this class is declared as final.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int den
      private data members for the numerator and denominator
      private int num
      private data members for the numerator and denominator

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rational()
      Default Value Constructor that uses the this method to set the numberator and denominator to 1 and 1
      Rational(int num, int den)
      Explicit Value Constructor that sets the numerator and denominator to the values passed in

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Rational add(Rational another)
      The add method calculates the new numerator by this numerator * another denominator + another numerator * this denominator.
      int compareTo(Rational another)
      The compareTo method calculates the Double value of this rational and uses the compareTo method based on the Double value of another rational
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      The equals method completes the standard checks and the returns true if this denominator is equal to another denominator and this numerator is equal to another numerator
      int hashCode()
      The hashCode method calculates a unique repeatable value by calculating the hashCode of this numerator and adding that value to the hashCode of this denominator;
      Rational reciprocal()
      The reciprocal creates a new Rational number with the correct sign in reduced form
      private void reduce()
      The reduce method reduces a rational number to its lowest terms by finding the GCD of the numerator and denominator and then dividing top and bottom by the GCD
      private void sign()
      The sign method ensures that if the negative sign is on the denominator it gets set on the numerator or if both the numerator and denominator are negative the rational number becomes positive
      java.lang.String toString()
      The toString returns a String in the form of numerator / denominator

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • Rational

        public Rational(int num,
                int den)
        Explicit Value Constructor that sets the numerator and denominator to the values passed in
        Parameters:
        num - Representing the numerator
        den - Representing the denominator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the den argument is equal to 0
        NOTE:

    • Method Detail

      • reduce

        private void reduce()
        The reduce method reduces a rational number to its lowest terms by finding the GCD of the numerator and denominator and then dividing top and bottom by the GCD
        NOTE:
        This method is called from the EVC

      • sign

        private void sign()
        The sign method ensures that if the negative sign is on the denominator it gets set on the numerator or if both the numerator and denominator are negative the rational number becomes positive
        NOTE:
        This method is called from the EVC

      • add

        public Rational add(Rational another)
        The add method calculates the new numerator by this numerator * another denominator + another numerator * this denominator. The new denominator by this denominator * another denominator
        Parameters:
        another - Representing the Rational to be added to this Rational
        Returns:
        Rational Representing a new Rational with correct sign in reduced form
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Rational another)
        The compareTo method calculates the Double value of this rational and uses the compareTo method based on the Double value of another rational
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Rational>
        Parameters:

        int Representing
        < 0 if this rational double value < another double value
        > 0 if this rational double value > another double value
